folder: Bowery Bay & North Beach., Queens, NY
text:
Bowery Bay (Queens): Shown are several views of North Beach, on Bowery Bay and Sanford Point. The Grand Pier, on Sanford Point, where Bowery Bay and Flushing Bay come together, can be seen in view 1. View 2 shows the North Beach Amusement Park. This whole area later became La Guardia Airport.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
1923
Views 1-4
title: Queens: Bowery Bay - North Beach.

folder: 94th Street & West End Avenue, Queens, NY
text:
North Beach Amusement Center, viewing north east from Jackson's Creek (Mill Creek) at 94th Street, showing in the distance in the center of the views the Jonathan K. Herrick house of 1852, which is located in 96th Street at 18th Drive. In 1840 one Boerum was the owner. His son Abraham of Horse Brook Road was born here. J.T. Sanford owned it from 1860 to 1873. In 1896 G. Kelterborn operated the place as a hotel. It was known as the Sanford Point Hotel at about 1900.

March 1923
View 2: March 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

text:
North Beach Amusement Center at 87th Street and Nineteenth Avenue. Nineteenth Avenue, is seen extending eastward from 87th Street, seen in the foreground. The Ferris Wheel seen in these views is located at the N.E. corner of Nineteenth Avenue, and 88th Street. Views 1-3 show buildings in the apex which includes the wheel. View No. 4 shows what happened after the fire in May 1926.

View 3:
View 4:

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

text:
Airports: La Guardia Field (Queens)--Viewing north toward the airport, before La Guardia Field was constructed. North Beach airport, a local field, is in the background, seen from Grand Central Parkway. View 2 is across Ditmars Boulevard and the Parkway; view 3 shows a crowd gathered at the westerly part of the field on the opening day. In the background is the Consolidated Edison Company's gas tank and coke plant, at Hunts Point, the Bronx.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: October 19, 1935
Views 2, 3: October, 1939
title: Queens] - Airports - La Guardia Field.

text:
Airports--La Guardia Field (Queens): Looking northwestward across Flushing Bay (foreground) and North Beach--the neck of land in the center--where La Guardia Field was later erected. In the background, across the East River, is the Consolidated Edison Company's large coke plant and gas tank at Hunts Point, the Bronx.

Views 1,2: W.P.A. photo
Five Boroughs Project

View 3: P. L. Sperr

1935 (?)
October 24, 1935
title: Queens] - Airports - La Guardia Field.
